content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-027-24-B
|Item_parent=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Item_parent_short=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the risk of bacterial vaginosis during pregnancy
|Description=Risk of threatened premature delivery
|Section=Follow-up and/or prognosis
|Contributors=Alexandre Vivanti, Philippe Deruelle
|Order=24}}
Bacterial vaginosis has been suspected of favouring premature delivery. This risk is currently being called into question.

question.title: Question
question.description: Risk of premature delivery due to bacterial vaginosis

option_a.title: Option A: Bacterial vaginosis is a known risk factor for premature delivery
option_a.description: This statement is supported by scientific evidence

option_b.title: Option B: Bacterial vaginosis is not a known risk factor for premature delivery
option_b.description: This statement is not supported by scientific evidence

option_c.title: Option C: The risk of premature delivery due to bacterial vaginosis is still being studied and debated
option_c.description: This statement is ambiguous and may be misleading

option_d.title: Option D: There is no conclusive evidence linking bacterial vaginosis to premature delivery
option_d.description: This statement is not supported by scientific evidence

correct_option.title: Correct Option
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
